name: LanguageTool
description: LanguageTool is an AI-powered grammar, style, and spell checker enhancing writing in over 30 languages.
longDescription: LanguageTool is an open-source proofreading software designed to help users improve their writing by detecting and correcting grammar, spelling, punctuation, and style errors across more than 30 languages. Founded in 2003 by Daniel Naber, it serves a wide range of users, including writers, students, professionals, and businesses, by offering tools for error-free communication. The platform supports browser extensions, desktop apps, and integrations with popular software like Microsoft Word and Google Docs, making it versatile for various writing contexts. Its mission is to enhance clarity and professionalism in writing, with a focus on multilingual support and user privacy through GDPR-compliant hosting and self-hosting options. LanguageTool’s free version provides robust core functionality, while its Premium version offers advanced features like improved error detection and style suggestions. Recently acquired by Learneo, Inc., LanguageTool continues to innovate with AI-driven tools like paraphrasing to meet diverse user needs.
features: Multilingual grammar checking corrects errors in over 30 languages, ensuring accurate and professional writing.
Browser extensions for Chrome, Firefox, and Edge enable real-time proofreading across web platforms like Google Docs and social media.
AI-based paraphrasing rephrases sentences to improve clarity, tone, or formality, enhancing communication effectiveness.
Team accounts allow businesses to enforce consistent style and branding with custom dictionaries and style guides.
Offline and self-hosting options ensure user privacy by allowing local text processing without server storage.
Integrations with Microsoft Word, LibreOffice, and other tools streamline proofreading within popular writing applications.
Style suggestions improve writing by detecting overused phrases, redundant words, and improper word choices.
Punctuation checking ensures correct usage of commas, dashes, and hyphens for polished text output.

faqs.question: What is LanguageTool and how does it work?
faqs.answer: LanguageTool is an AI-powered tool that checks grammar, spelling, punctuation, and style in over 30 languages, highlighting errors and offering suggestions for improvement. It works via browser extensions, apps, or integrations with tools like Microsoft Word.

faqs.question: Is LanguageTool free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, LanguageTool offers a free plan with core grammar and spelling checks, though some advanced features require a Premium subscription.

faqs.question: Can LanguageTool be used offline?
faqs.answer: Yes, LanguageTool’s core app can be downloaded for offline use, and self-hosting options are available for enhanced privacy.

faqs.question: Which languages does LanguageTool support?
faqs.answer: LanguageTool supports over 30 languages, including English, Spanish, French, German, and many others, with rules maintained by native-speaking volunteers.

faqs.question: Does LanguageTool store my text?
faqs.answer: LanguageTool does not store text processed via browser extensions, and its GDPR-compliant hosting ensures privacy, with self-hosting options for further control.

faqs.question: Can LanguageTool integrate with Microsoft Word?
faqs.answer: Yes, LanguageTool integrates with Microsoft Word (2016 or later) and other word processors, but some integrations may require a Premium subscription.

faqs.question: How does LanguageTool compare to Grammarly?
faqs.answer: LanguageTool offers robust multilingual support and open-source flexibility, making it a strong alternative to Grammarly, especially for non-English writers, though it may have fewer advanced features.

faqs.question: Is LanguageTool suitable for academic writing?
faqs.answer: Yes, LanguageTool helps students and academics ensure error-free theses, essays, and papers with grammar, style, and punctuation checks.
